Experience

Walmart Labs | Software Engineer | Bentonville, AR
02/2019-Present
Description
  • Microservice for generating unique labels to be used around the warehouse. The unique label is considered as an id for pallets, stable stock, or anything inside the warehouse. Used spring boot, SQL Server, Azure, mockito for unit testing, and cucumber for integration tests. The product saves deployment time about 50% because it's deployed on azure rather than on-prem servers.
  • A microservice to handle CRUD operations for workgroups in a warehouse. Deployed on azure saving time rather than deploying on-prem. Microservice was written using spring boot, SQL server, Jmockit, and Cucumber. Grafana for metrics to show latency time and Splunk for logging.
  • Built a microservice to calculate user workâ€™s performance based on the number of activities throughout the day. The microservice is 70% faster than the old version. Implemented multithreading to accept multiple users in order to save time and reduce network calls. Developed using spring boot, Cassandra, spring async, Jmockit, and cucumber.
  • Developing a microservice to pregenerate labels and send it to ACL(automated consolidate labeler) and symbiotic, a machine that is currently being using only in 1 warehouse. ACL is a product that automatically scans, prints labels, and verifies the label is stick on the box or pallet. ACL saves Walmart about $43 million in labor costs. Developed in spring boot, mongo db, mockito, and cucumber.
